years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Smart people and fast pace environment.

review_title: Not the best place to work as analyst
years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Company is only focused on the PMs. The payouts are great for the PMs.
cons: Mgmt could care less about the analysts. If the PM does well then Senior Mgmt is happy with the analysts. Senior Mgmt doesn’t have any way of judging how good the analysts are.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: Autonomy to initiate and drive projects. Great tech resources. Very intelligent colleagues. Pays very well, along with generous severance. Excellent name to have on our resume, will open many doors.
cons: Poor management. As it's very silo'd, the management experience may differ among Ops teams. In my experience, the management style was fear based with constant criticism. No written annual review process. Women's ideas and opinions were not valued. Not many opportunities for internal mobility. Cliquey atmosphere.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: Great working environment, sharp colleagues who are strong technically and laid back.
cons: Place is slowly turning into a bank, increasing levels of bureaucracy.

review_title: Overall a nice company to work for
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Good team atmosphere, free to choose the technology to implement things in, good salary, decent working hours
cons: Groups are pretty insulated, there is not too much intra-company interactions.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Flexible atmosphere, nice service and people

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year

review_title: Rewarding work, but difficult to grow

review_title: Very well run pleasant place to work. Friendly helpful staff.
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Working in the trading area, there was very little politics. The only thing that mattered was the profitability of your group.
cons: If you trading group had a bad year or two, you were out.

review_title: Opportunity to learn but bad work/life balance
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: For a firm this size, there are lots of opportunity to learn different technology. Compensation and benefits are on par with other hedge fund of this size.
cons: No growth opportunity and bad work life balance. Teams are very siloed and lots of duplicated work and overlapping responsibilities.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium for less than a year
pros: Great culture and team
cons: Quite intense and sometimes work life balance isn’t good

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium for less than a year
pros: A big shop, plenty of people to meet, great location. Friendly enough people given the line of work. Good opportunities for advancement, but a very competitive environment (in a good way, friendly competition).
cons: The office was a bit plain, but apparently they will be relocating as they expand a bit.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Independence and opportunities to work your own way. Honesty from management.
cons: Not a ton of growth, salary tied to firm performance.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: challenges you, you can meet other interns in the program and learn from them as well. good compensation.
cons: Company culture is not consistent among different teams, a little hard to adjust to this kind of environment

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: High payouts - they leave you alone to manage your portfolio as you please (within limits)
cons: When I say they leave you alone, I mean completely alone - there is no support whatsoever in terms of understanding what's going in the market. Trading execution is terrible as you compete for flow with other traders (including the quants. Everyone is a number - you could be fired tomorrow and no one will care.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Great infrastructure, unlimited capital, no interference on your investment process.
cons: Firm is so big (for a hedge fund) that teams can feel silo'd from each other. Facilities/workspace are substandard, definitely worse than at competitors.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Experience can be gained throughout all aspects of the HF business
cons: No growth opportunities, very silo'd

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: Tier one hedge fund. High quality, very risk conscientious
cons: Not really any. Not a super formal internship program.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Long track record of strong investment performance
cons: Non efficient infrastructure model and bifurcated responsibilities

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium
pros: Great pay, good hours. Teams are at the mercy of the team leads rules - good thing for some, bad thing for others. Good balance of BAU and new projects.
cons: Communication between towers needs work, more focus on discussion rather than competition.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Good pay....good hours....good culture. Good management
cons: Small teams. Low opportunity for growth.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Cleanest model of business for a portfolio manager with top line expenses, strong infrastructure and reasonable risk limits
cons: No sense of culture. Internal politics amongst management. Bit stuck in the past with adoption of technology, innovation and creativity lacking relative to peers.

employee_status: Senior Building Engineer in New York, NY
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium for less than a year
pros: I worked there for eight months on contract basis. People are very knowledgeable and friendly. Weekly team meeting helps members to stay on same page. Complementary launch on Friday. Wine test once in a month
cons: Nothing to add as cons.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Good resources and infrastructure. Respected brand.
cons: increased middle management creates bureaucracy. become just another cog in the wheel

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: The recruiting process was very quick and transparent. I met with 8 people in one week- spread out across 3 days. They were very flexible/accommodating to my work schedule as it was difficult for me to break away from my current full-time job to come in. The interviews themselves felt like conversations and not your "typical Q&A interview". Everyone I met with was friendly and down to earth which helped the conversation flow and allowed me to feel comfortable in asking any questions I had. The team seemed genuine and I got a great sense for their culture. I walked away from the first meeting wanting the job.
cons: The interview process itself was quick but the feedback on a final decision took a bit longer- I don't hold this against the company however. I was the first candidate they met with for a "back-fill" position and the team needed time to get through additional candidate interviews. Given their transparency from the beginning, I was prepared in knowing the final decision would take time.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: The people here are brilliant and come from the best firms across the street, yet everybody is thoughtful and approachable. Millennium is on the cutting edge of almost every area in hedge fund investing, so the problems you get to work on are both challenging and rewarding.
cons: The ethos of the company is fairly Spartan. There aren't a lot of perks or luxurious office space.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Great team with strong, experienced management. Culture is collaborative while employees have freedom to solve problems their own way, which is not an easy balance to achieve. Business is mature with long, successful track record.
cons: Office space is nothing to write home about.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Can scale pay quickly if team performs well
cons: No support from management - investment teams are on their own. Zero ability of management to track team member performance outside of entire team P&L

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Great corporate and sell-side access Decent amount of independence/ flexibility for portfolio managers
cons: Turnover is absurdly high PMs are treated like a number. Analysts are treated like they don't even exist - no attempt is made to train or retain analysts. If your PM gets fired you're sol Compensation for analysts is terrible The Millennium name is a taint on your resume to reputable firms Basically a body shop lower - common denominator employer in hedge fund land Facilities are gross

no growth
sit at desk all day , answer calls

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 10 years

review_title: not transparent or truthful or current tech

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 5 years

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 8 years
pros: Extremely successful buyside hedge fund. Considered top 3 fund in NY - probably number one for longevity and consisten returns 14% over 25 years.
cons: Has become more institutionalized in recent years. Operates more closely to a large bank than small creative Hedge Fund. From a data perspective, is very much reactionary than proactive when it comes to data procurement strategies.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Leave u alone, owner is a special person, You go at your own pace and they really leave it up to you as far as how uch money you manage
cons: dont necessarily let you go in a different direction if that is what you want to pursue

review_title: Great Place to Work, Not a Place with Clear Defined Career Paths

review_title: very good salaries, very good equipment

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: if you do well, you get paid well

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: It's a good place to learn if you are up for doing real work as intern. My team lets me dive into work straightaway, and I could see results immediately.
cons: There is not much diversity in the firm in terms of people - same as many similar investment firms.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium for less than a year
pros: The people you work with are very smart and also highly experienced. The amount of expertise and knowledge people bring to the table elevates the level of discussion. This is not just a job, its on-job learning, everyday.
cons: Not any specific cons as such but I guess this holds good for any NYC based financial services firm. The culture is very uptight unlike Silicon Valley culture.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Millennium continues to grow. They hire the best talent in all areas of the firm. The review process is thorough and balanced. The work environment in technology is high paced and project oriented. Careful prioritization and selection of projects leads to clear understanding of what is on deck. Technology is continuously improving in both the Hardware and Software areas.
cons: Work / Life balance: The work is challenging and will require your full dedication possibly including several evenings a week to keep pace. Priorities often change resulting in two steps forward, one step back feeling.

review_title: Great job if you can keep it
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: competitive payouts, lots of resources. non-political environment. very much a meritocracy. good reputation on the street so all your calls get answered.
cons: you will be let go if you no longer add value to the team. this is true of any company but an especially brutal truth at MIllennium. There is no such thing as team building or such things.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: Good resources, good IT support (not the most relevant thing if you are a research analyst)
cons: Very bureaucratic Everyone is crammed up in cubicles (no way to do research) Pods within the same sector are very catty between each other.

review_title: I'd question some of these 4-5 star reviews....
years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Low cost structure for portfolio managers & higher payouts then competitors.
cons: Higher payouts come at a price. Management adjusts individuals/pods agreed upon stops at any point in time, particularly when the overall fund is experiencing a down day.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: Started as a laid back envirnoment
cons: New operations management only looks out for themselves and does not care about previous employees and there skills. Just looked to clean house and bring in there own.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: Decent % payouts. Come and go as you please.
cons: Lousy base salary, operationally intensive, segregated, dated technology(aside from Position Management System). Management is non-communicative, socially awkward to put it bluntly and not to be trusted.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than a year
pros: Bright/motivated people, advanced infrastructure/technology, fair/enticing rewarding mechanism. You get to work in full cycle of from trading idea generation to portfolio management. You get paid by what you produce. It's a great place to make impact if you are smart and dedicated.
cons: Not so much except that the nature of groups working orthogonally might not be a fit for everyone. You gotta be very independent to generate results.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Gain exposure to a number of bright market participants and are able to stress test trading ideas off some of the best in the business. The trading technology and infrastructure are top notch.
cons: I do not have anything bad to say about this place. I am sure there is some variability in one's experience depending on the group/manager you work for.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: You work alongside some very intelligent and talented individuals. There is much expected of you here and you will be groomed for future success at future companies. Needless to say, the name in itself will open doors for you as well.
cons: It is so large that the culture resembles a big bank and less a small hedge fund. The politics are severe and despite your loyalty to the company, there is no loyalty to you. Make a big enough mistake (and it need not be large) and you are gone. Just had a kid? Bought a new house? Fallen on hard times? They don't care. Cross them, and gone. Just like that. Also, there is no support or guidance. People are quick to fault find and finger point so don't dare ask a question or you will become the butt of gossip as an incompetent who should not be working at mlp. They are also a bit on the cheap side for compensation and benefits.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time
pros: Great company with room for growth. very private
cons: i had a great time at millennium, don't have much cons in my eyes.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: Flexible, entrepreneurial, flat work environment
cons: Did not have any, great experience.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Decent comp structure, talented individuals across all lines of business. Free lunch but only on Fridays.
cons: Make sure you know what you're getting into by going here. Every negative thing you hear about this place is true. Management makes promises to lure you in and delivers whatever they see fit once you've joined. Limited bandwith. Back office infrastructure is abysmal. There's some sharp people here. However, dialogue among people is discouraged for fear of ruining the fund's diversification so little sharing of information or ideas occurs. Turnover is ridiculously high here and you get the sense every employee is one wrong move away from being shown the exit. Frankly, most people seem pretty unhappy here. Trading floors are like libraries, I'd imagine morgues are more lively.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: The firm is filled with smart people who work hard and are good at their job. The firm has a good payout ratio compared to comps.
cons: There is very little culture. Risk controls are right and the pressure to perform is intense with your job on the line.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 8 years
pros: As a trading group you have your own little hedge fund within. Millennium keeps you fairly walled off from other groups. The capital is allocated to you and you simply invest and trade without regards to overall fund strategy. That is handled by hiring of diverse groups.
cons: Some of the shared costs of the firm that you may not benefit from are allocated across all trading groups

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium
pros: Good respected company. Good pay. Pizza on Fridays.
cons: Technology is viewed as a cost center. Promotions are extremely rare in technology. Very little freedom. Time tracking systems.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: It is a very good company with good reputation.
cons: Unfortunately I do not get the opportunity to grow here.

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: None, do not work here
cons: Backstabbers, liars and very political

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time
pros: Flexible hours, compensation on par with comparable businesses, up to date technology, midtown location, as well as offices in London and Asia, closeness to the business
cons: Culture is changing to be more corporate, lots of management layers, huge emphasis on outsourcing, ineffective top tech managers, high turnover, no career path

years_at_company: I worked at Millennium full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Very competitive, great incentives to make you work long hours
cons: Cut throat, so need to do more.

years_at_company: I have been working at Millennium full-time for more than 8 years
pros: Great work environment to work in
cons: lack of internal communication which makes for surprises
